Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: a natural shampoo that works
Review: I don’t know if it’s good or bad that my hair feels clean after I use this.  The obvious disadvantage to this is I have to use a conditioner, there’s no getting around it.  And like commercial brands of shampoo my hair still has some morning frizz.  However, the advantage is that I know it works.I have tried a LOT of natural shampoos and my hair doesn’t have that clean feel and can only go a day, maybe 2 before needing washed because it looks greasy.  This shampoo is natural but my hair feels clean, even after conditioner, and doesn’t get greasy again fast.  Yet my hair feels so soft, even days later, even the gray hair.  And I have reduced crazy fly aways (I still have mild fly away).It is a very thick shampoo so takes some practice to get the right amount.  It’s a pricey bottle as well but I can get away with the same amount of shampoo as if I used a commercial brand whereas most natural shampoos I have to use twice as much to even hope for a cleanliness to my hair so this lasts longer than other natural brands I’ve used, it makes up for the price.  It does not lather the same as commercial shampoos but it does lather the same or better than other natural brands.  It does not have to lather to work so don’t use more than you need.The smell is also amazing.  This is a definite win for a natural brand.  I will say that it does still have a long list of ingredients though.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Contains Toxic Ingredients
Review: There are many shampoos out there billing their products as vegan, animal-cruelty free, and/or organic.However, if you search the individual ingredients on Environmental Working Group's website, you'll find many -- like this one -- contain ingredients that cause reproductive harm or are environmental toxins or are carcinogenic if not thoroughly rinsed off the skin.The fact children, who are more susceptible to the harmful effects of toxins because of their smaller size and the fact their cells are still dividing and multiplying as they grow, are also using these products makes it evermore imperative the FDA or another government agency start regulating the cosmetics industry better.It's a shame these companies don't put more research into the so-called "safer" ingredients they use, to ensure they don't harm customers and/or the environment.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: We both liked using this shampoo. My wife said afterward her hair has fewer tangles than the shampoo she was using before. We both felt our hair was softer and more manageable – which isn’t a big feat for my short hair but it is for my wife’s medium to long hair. It smells good and is pleasant to use.The vegan claim may strike people as laughable since it seems silly that any animal products find their way into shampoo. I did some research finding out that it’s more than likely that non-vegan shampoos do contain some or even many animal products. It’s hardly a sure thing since US labeling requirements don’t identify animal-sourced items when there’s doubt with products that can be animal or non-animal derived.My wife’s a vegan so that this shampoo is free of animal parts scored big points with her. I have to agree. I’d prefer no animal products unless absolutely necessary. Since this shampoo does a great job and leaves the animals alone, it rates highly in our household.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have to admit I laughed at this shampoo having traveled to Amazon before arriving one island over (a 15 minute flight( on Oahu.  I am not sure how well known Awapuhi (locally known as shampoo ginger, for its' fragrant sap) is on the continent.  It is a ginger relative which produces large, cone shaped flowers (image attached) that release a fragrant liquid, I am not sure if it would properly be called sap, when squeezed.  It is often found when hiking in wet areas, and actually grows in standing water.  It is a much loved flower here, with a beautiful fragrance.  I had to see hgow well it translated.  As something of a fragrance fiend I have yet to find a gardenia perfume which smells anything like gardenia, or a jasmine which is really true (well, actually I have found the jasmine in s small British niche perfume) but it is difficult to find because flower essences are most often steam extracted which leaves them smelling cooked, not much like the flower.  Awapuhi is different because of the abundance of fragrant liquid (sap?) and Maui Moisture seems to have captured it well!  The scent is true, it is strong and really a lovely fragrance.  That is where the 4 stars comes from.  Actually, I would give the fragrance 5 stars.  It is very well done.The shampoo I was less happy with.  For one, the bottle is not sealed.  I am frankly surprised UPS delivered it.  It was leaking so badly that the envelope it was shipped in was soaked and dripping.  Something which has to travel as far as this does really ought to have the bottle sealed.The shampoo is an odd combination of ingredients for shampoo.  The first ingredient is aloe vera, which suddenly seems to be in everything.  It is abundant, and cheap.  A friend gave me a plant about 15 years ago.  I now have hundreds, despite donating hundreds each year to my kids' school carnival.  Aloe is actually an astringent.  It is typically applied to burns.  The sap is thick and sticky.  I do not know why anyone would want to put it in their hair.  I am actually allergic to aloe, so I gave this shampoo to my daughter to test.  She has several feet of hair and is very particular about what she uses.  No doubt she was delighted by the natural ingredients, and also the avapuhi.  The shampoo also contains coconut milk, which is also everywhere.  I am very glad the shampoo does not smell like coconut, which I am personally sick of, and makes me think of cheap tourist sunscreen.  That said, you do not get that feel from this shampoo.  Coconut is fatty, and much better for your hair or skin than your body. (Nutritionists says not to consume it ever because of the high saturated fats).  That said, the oil is a lot mkore moisturizing than the milk, so it was sort of an odd choice.  I am not seeing where the moisture comes from.  The scent is wonderful, but I am less happy with it as a shampoo.  It is something my daughter and I both may not notice as we use conditioner, but the ingredients are not especially moistruizing.  This is not a shampoo I would use without conditioner, but it will not strip your hair either like a lot of shampoos do.The ingredients are natural, a huge plus.  The scent is lovely, really well done here.,  Those who know awapuhi will be impressed, those who don't ought to be delighted by the scent.  I rated it 4 stars because it is all natural and the fragrance is lovely but it is not the best shampooo I have used, and they really do need to seal the bottles so that they can travel safely thousands of miles by air.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: pretty decent shampoo
Review: EDIT / UPDATE:  I tried this shampoo again and didn't follow it with the Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate Shea Butter conditioner, and had good results.  So it's the conditioner that wreaks havoc on my hair, turning it dry and straw-like.But definintely CAN use this Maui shine shampoo with a different conditioner and my hair is definitely soft and "light" feeling, so I do recommend this shampoo!****************************************'Well this was an odd experience (btw, I purchased mine at Target).  I have some natural wave to my hair, but can also easily straighten it.  Seems kind "average" hair.This shampoo, along with the Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate Shea Butter conditioner, were a really bad combo for my hair.  Even using the conditioner, my hair didn't feel soft at all while I was conditioning it.  It felt soft of 'dry' and straw-like.I've only used this combo twice but am giving both products away because at first I thought it was a fluke that my hair felt so coarse and straw-like.  A couple of weeks later I used both products again and nope.  Bad idea.  My hair is coarse today and very very dry  (the day after using these).Seems odd since these are both supposed to be moisturizing.  And I have great results with Dove Moisture products and Aussie and Redken, as well as a host of others.  Anyway, just didn't work for me.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: First Ingredient is Aloe Vera
Review: This shampoo is more "natural" than most others on the market.  Aloe Vera is the first ingredient, which means the consistency is alot like, well, aloe vera.  Clear, a bit slimy and comes out in glurp of shampoo. I loved scent of the shampoo, which has ginger and florals.  I will say that after the shampo, my hair was very tangly and conditioning was an absolute must.  I  liked this shampoo enough that I will likely purchase the conditioner.Would give 5 stars, but some of the ingredients are still too chemicall-y for the natural/vegan branding of this shampoo.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: + Absolutely amazing smell+ Hair feels amazingly clean after use; coming from Tree to Tub, I feel a huge improvement+ Vegan friendly+ Made with aloe, so a natural first ingredient+ Requires very little product to get a “clean” feeling± Smell does not seem to last for more than 1 hour± Label says that this is effective at detangling, but hasn’t been the case for me- Should have a protective seal or tape to prevent leaks----------------------------------------------The tropical smell of this shampoo is absolutely alluring, inviting almost anyone into the many wonderful smells that make Hawai’i, well... Hawai’i. The awapuhi smells genuine, and the label gets it right when it states that the awapuhi flower is generally used in shampoos. It feels authentic, and there is just so much that this product gets right.One of the good things about this product is the fact that it is sulfate free. Even more so, it is free from parabens, silicones, and dyes, all the while maintaining a vegan label. Supposedly it detangles and hydrates hair, but so far, I’ve only experienced the hydration. When kept long, my hair notoriously tangles often, so I had rather high hopes when I saw this one advertising to combat that. While it hasn’t helped with the one issue, at least my hair isn’t as staticky as it used to be anymore due to the increase in hydration.The only real gripe I have is with the protective seal, or really, lack thereof. When the shampoo arrived, I was saddened by the sight of an exploded bottled - half the content was sludging about in the bag. If you’re actually purchasing your own bottles, then this is unacceptable. Perhaps having a small piece of tape would be enough to combat the abuse experienced during delivery. Otherwise, again, this is unacceptable when it seems to be a prevalent issue mentioned throughout reviews.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I've been looking for a shampoo that can smooth out my coarse, curly hair without making it greasy or weighing it down.  It is usually visibly tangled, wavy, and dull, but this shampoo makes it straight and shiny. My hair used to look so damaged, because it wasn't fully straight, but also not completely wavy. It was always a mess and I had to brush it every hour. It was dull and course to the touch, and you couldn't even run your hand through it. My scalp was also irritated (possibly from my last shampoo). Now, my hair feels light and soft, and so much less dull. It gets tangled way less easily, and my flyaways and split ends have calmed down.  This shampoo relaxes my tight curls and gives my hair soft waves. Hair looks healthy and still has good volume despite how moisturizing the shampoo is. I can go a few days without washing my hair before it becomes greasy.  The smell is great, doesn't smell too powerful or artificial.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: to the fool that said this product has DMDM
Review: i don’t write reviews at all but misinformation is something i can’t stand. DMDM is not listed anywhere in the ingredient list even under its most common name glydant. no this won’t make your hair fall out. do some research ppl the amount of DMDM used in most cosmetic products is minimal. also a company like maui would get a big lawsuit if they used a harsh preservative like that since they pride themselves on being vegan/natural

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is the first all natural shampoo we have ever tried. It comes in something that looks like a yogurt or fruit drink, and it also smells like fruit punch! Keep it away from the young kids. The shampoo has a thick consistency. I had to either wait or squeeze it out slowly. It does a wonderful job cleaning my hair and lathers generously. You don't need to use much to get the job done. It really smells like a fruit drink.  After rinsing it off with water, the hair is clean but becomes lumpy and stiff. I had to finish it off with a conditioner, which ended up smothering the strong fruit scent.  A few hours later, my hair still feels very clean and my scalp is not dried out as before. This Maui shampoo doesn't dry out the scalp! I'm very impressed.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I really love the floral fruity scent although it goes away after in short time. It keeps my hair shiny and really can feel the clearness. In the other word, the condition is a must after using Maui moisture shine vegan shampoo. Otherwise the next day my medium length hair would be tangled and fuzzy. This is a small bottle (13 oz) with the price over $10, I may use it with other cheaper shampoo so it would not runs out too fast.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Nice shampoo!
Review: This is a nice shampoo! I have a daughter with very curly, and very dry hair...that being said she also spends a lot of time outside and in the dirt. This makes something that actually still cleans a MUST in our house. This works really well. I am impressed with how little frizz we are seeing in her hair now. We definitely still need conditioner, but this is a really awesome base that cleans well. My big complaint is that it is a bit strong in the scent department, but it does tame nicely as you rinse and then your hair dries. Great option for those who want to buy a greener product, but are afraid it won't clean well. This definitely will!

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have extremely dry hair with sensitive, problematic scalp. So when I choose my daily shampoo I do extra research to see if the companies put anything bad ingredients in to the shampoo/treatment. I chose this shampoo because This Maui shampoo is Free from silicones, sulfated surfactants, parabens, mineral oil, gluten and synthetic dye, this shampoo is vegan! How awesome is that. It’s been about a week and half now since I started using this shampoo. My scalp is clean, my hair is shiner than ever! I would highly recommend this shampoo to anyone!

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Pricy but lovely sulfate-free shampoo
Review: The only thing not to like is the price. I have to use a lot of this product for my shoulder-length hair (like the size of a ping-pong ball), and it takes more work to get a nice lather than a product with sulfates. However, it is possible to work up a beautiful lather, and the smell is lovely. For me, the bottle will last about 10 shampooings.  This does allow me to go a few days between shampoos so the bottle is about a month's supply.  The shampoo is moisturizing, but a conditioner is mandatory. After rinsing and before shampooing, my hair is extremely snarly and hard to comb through. But adding a conditioner makes this really work. My hair is shiny and bouncy and good smelling with this product.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have a couple of other Maui products and they perform well on my 4a textured hair. I was excited about this one because its supposed to have great slip when washing which is crucial for detangling my curls. Instead of it being a fluid liquid like most other shampoos, this one came out like a thick gel consistency which lathered well. I didn’t need much to wash my hair and it left my hair feeling a little too squeaky clean but not completely stripped. It did nothing for detangling my hair, because it left it so clean I had to gently detangle afterwards with my conditioner. It smells really nice and the scent only slightly lingers on the hair.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Fresh ginger scent, thick formula.  Sulfate free, but with c14-16 sulfonate as a clarifying cleanser. Thorough but non stripping cleansing shampoo.  With curly hair, I use gobs of conditioner no matter what.  I loosely follow the Curly Girl Method, and this shampoo fits the bill.  No sulfates, no silicones, no drying alcohols.  Great shampoo, my hair is soft, shiny, and clean feeling.  No straw like drying or super frizz. Nice to have another shampoo available.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This has a nice shimmery gold bottle which I really liked (it didn't leak during shipment either).It is said to contain aloe water. The shampoo is a pretty thick gel like consistency and it bubbles quite easily.The scent is a nice, fresh, citrus-y, fruity scent that I can't really identify what it is. It's not too strong, just right.It's quite nice though! The shampoo left my straight, mid-back length hair really soft and also feeling squeaky clean. I really like this shampoo and will continue using this for a while to see if it improves hair health.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: smells so good
Review: I'm in love with the smell of this shampoo.  It's light, but delicious.  The shampoo lathers up nicely, and rinses out without leaving any leftover residue.  After using my hair was a little frizzier than when I use my normal shampoo.  My hair didn't become greasy and in need of another washing until 3 days later which is pretty good.  I've used it several times and I'm going to keep using it, and see how it goes.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Works amazingly and smells very nice
Review: I really liked this shampoo. It made my hair feel way cleaner than with the Pantene shampoo I normally use and the smell is awesome! I had my 9 year old use it as well since her hair gets greasy looking after just two days and it’s helped her hair a lot to stay fresh and clean looking as well. I hope to get the conditioner soon to try that out as well. I love that it doesn’t include bad parabens and all that junk other brands use that are bad for hair and that it’s not tested on animals. Over all I highly recommend!

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This smells amazing and lathes really well. The shampoo itself is very Gel-like rather than creamy, it makes it a little difficult to extract the appropriate amount from the shampoo bottle because it comes out in a clump almost, but you only need very little. I love the ingredients.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This shampoo serves it purpose well. It cleanses your hair and leaves it feeling nice and smelling fresh. However, the texture of the shampoo is kind of goopy. It's thick and a little slimy feeling, which was a bit of surprise. Thankfully, all of that washes out and does not leave your hair feeling weird. But, then again, I did use it with my regular conditioner.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Great, but not the best.
Review: I’ve been using this shampoo for about three weeks now, and i found that compared to other non vegan shampoos it really doesn’t make a difference.For a moisturizing shampoo it does dry out my hair quit a bit,The scent smells amazing and the packaging is beautiful!Would make a great gift.Overall would recommend.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: A very nice shampoo. It smells amazing and fresh. Softening and moisturizing. A bit of a shine. I'll keep using it and update since I've only used it once so far. It's not meant to create a ton of suds since it doesn't have all the chemicals. It's a translucent shampoo. A little goes a long way if you're cleaning your hair and not just trying to lather up.Update 12/18: definitely adds volume. Hair is healthier looking too..

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: First thing I have to say is how good it smells! After I washed & dryed my hair, I tied it up for work. When I came home & let my hair down I got that wonderful smell all over again. I have to say with long hair I'm not sure how long this 13 oz bottle will last. But I can say that I didn't have as many tangles as I usually do. Very nice product!

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Aloe is the first ingredient which is no surprise the first time you squeeze out the gelatinous goop. It really is like squeezing out a fresh aloe leaf. The scent is fruity tropical which is nice. It doesn't lather up that much which is consistent with a sulfate-free shampoo. If you love aloe, this might be the perfect shampoo for you.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: First off, this shampoo smells terrific!  It is Maui in a bottle.  Second, this shampoo has an excellent lather so you don't need to use too much at a time.  My hair is color treated and there was no stripping of color.  Last, my hair was soft and shiny after stying.  I will purchase again!

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Causes dryness
Review: I honestly never leave reviews, but I was so excited to use this product; only to find out it’s been causing extreme dryness to my scalp! I’ve never had a shampoo cause my scalp to become SO dry!! It made my ends feel so stiff and brittle even when followed by the conditioner… I don’t recommend.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Don’t buy it!
Review: I hate it! My hair is normally pretty soft and healthy. It’s not color treated and I rarely use heat. This shampoo and conditioner made my hair dry and tangled. Even after I brush my hair, after 5 minutes it goes right back to being tangled. My hair looks dull and gross now. I will be throwing this stuff away. Waste of money!

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: made my hair shine
Review: I love the shine

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Only used it once. I can't tell the difference but the ingredients in this shampoo are very natural which I like. I also find the scent pleasant.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Smells good
Review: This stuff smells good, and moisturizes okay, but it's a small bottle and it leaks. So beware.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I used this product just once and I noticed a shine to my hair already. The shampoo smells very nice as well. Would recommend.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Love this shampoo and conditioner.
Review: I'm 75 and this shampoo and conditioner softened my gray hair. It has a good scent and it's price is great.  Love it!!

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Great Conditioner
Review: I am very picky about my hair products. I saw this on TikTok And decided to give it a try. I am not disappointed. I love the way my hair feels especially after I blow dry it. It doesn’t feel dry and it’s super soft.Smells great but not too strong.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Love it!
Review: I got this on a Curlbox and now I can't live without it! Awesome products for curly hair!

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Lo volveria a comprar
Review: Este shampoo tiene un olor delicioso, deja mi cabello hidratado, con un olor rico, con poco hace buena espuma, mi cabello no se enrreda es fácil de peinar

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Love
Review: I love all Maui products, they all leave my hair so soft and healthy

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Fantastic! Best ever.
Review: I love this shampoo and conditioner. Best ever. Leaves my hair light & fluffy.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: maui moisture shampoo
Review: this product keeps my hair so moisturized and smells amazing!!

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Made my hair so soft
Review: Smells good and leave hair soft and manageable

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Fake in the bottle!!!
Review: This is a FAKE in the bottle and I will be getting my money back!!!!!

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Review Result:[Buy Today, Get it Someday, or Skip Past Any day]Buy Today, this shampoo is just as good as all the other fancy shampoos I’ve tried.  It isn’t better but, it’s on par with the fancy store-bought sulfate free shampoos out there. It’s worth the buy as a slightly more natural alternative.Full ReviewI used this shampoo for 4 days before writing this review.  My standard shampoo before this was an $8 store-bought sulfate free shampoo.  A bit of background. I have very, very… very dry hair that’s maybe a bit thinner than ideal, age 33 male. This was just as good as my old shampoo but not really better. My hair wasn’t improved. It seemed about the same to me.  This shampoo does have an immensely sweet scent.  That’s a plus or a minus depending on who you ask.  It was so sweet, I seriously felt like I needed to taste it… I didn’t because it’s shampoo, but I had a strong urge to drink it…Anyway, it does beat out the standard store shampoo due to its many natural ingredients. But, that’s only if you care about that type of thing. I’m a scientist… so I don’t… Oh well…But bottom line, a good shampoo worth buying. I would say.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: El producto es originalLo que me gustó:-Tiene un aroma muy rico (fancy) perfumado sin ser dulce-deja el cabello limpio aún en cabello graso-no maltrata el cabello-La botella es muy muy bonita y le da un toque elegante al bañoLo que no me gustó:-En clima frío se siente un poco gelatinoso-tienes que asegurarte de enjuagarlo bienEspero que esta reseña te sirva

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: El olor es muy rico pero no es mi shampoo favorito de la marca por mi tipo de pelo. Si no necesitas hidratación extra, no lo pidas, porque te lo podría dejar algo graso. Yo sólo lo uso 2 veces por semana y así es como me ha funcionado. Pero sí lo recomiendo para personas que tengan cuero cabelludo seco / cabello seco.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: Received product that was leaking in the box.  Cap does not appear to have any seal.  Not sure if this is a new product or used or ??? Used it anyway and feels quite good though.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: Huele muy rico, es espeso, así que rinde bastante, excelente relación precio, calidad, me ha funcionado para cabello, con alisado permanente.

Product: Maui Moisture Shine + Awapuhi Moisturizing Vegan Conditioner with Oils for Shiny Hair Silicone & SulfateFree Surfactant Aloe Conditioner to Hydrate Detangle Hair, Coconut, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: El frasco venía derramado y sucio dentro de una bolsa

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Faulty shipping - 2 damaged bottle deliveries
Review: I would love to give a rating for the product itself but unable to use it because bottle is arriving fully leaked into box (1st delivery) or broken lid and fully leaked again. The bottle seems to be not good quality and needs to be improved or shipped as a fragile item. Disappointed!

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: My daughter has very thick, curly/wavy hair. It gets pretty frizzy/flyaway. She's 8 so we don't use any heat styling tools and she's not crazy about putting in products. So shampoo is what we've got to help those curls and tame the flyaway frizz. The smell of this shampoo is great in a sweet-smelling way. She seemed to have more definition in her curls, but she also seems like she has more frizz/flyaways.  Her 4 year old brother just dumped out the rest of the bottle so I think we will try something else.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Clean hair that isn't stripped dry!
Review: Full disclosure-- In an attempt to use as few products as possible (I only buy what's necessary, I hate collecting bottles of things)  I used to use an apple cider vinegar rinse and some conditioner. This was okay for my hair, but it wasn't the best.Enter this product (recommended to me by another curly friend). I now wash with this , follow it with an herbal rinse, then use a Maui Moisture hair butter to detangle and style my hair. I like the way the shampoo makes my hair feel. It's clean but it's still moisturized. A fair word of warning-- I did use this after doing an oil treatment once and it did NOT get all the oil out. Be mindful of that. You may need something more powerful. However, since I started using this shampoo, I no longer feel the need to pre-poo with oil. Love this stuff!

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Nope!
Review: As a long time user of Shea Moisture Curl & Shine and Not Your Mother’s Curl Defining... this falls waaaaay short. I read the reviews and as someone with long, thick, curly hair I thought I’d give it a go. I can get away with using both the products I mentioned without their partner conditioners and am always fairly pleased to find tangles are still not a war. Of course to dbl down the Shea Moisture Curl & Shine Conditioner is a staple in my house, but THIS product was not nearly the moisturizing I thought it might be based on reviews, and though the scent was nice I was disappointed at the difference I noticed when trying to detangle - ouch! Won’t purchase again, and by the 3rd wash I knew there wouldn’t be a 4th.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: I like the shampoo very much
Review: I think this item was discontinued because I can't find it in the stores here in Florida.  I like the shampoo very much.  I have very wavy hair that is also highlighted.  I just find it doesn't strip my hair and leaves it feeling clean.  I have to wash my hair everyday so this is a nice product.  I hope it wasn't discontinued because I like it a lot.  The shampoo doesn't have a scent or if it does it is very light so if you want a perfumy smelling shampoo this isn't for you.  I like this product a lot.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Works amazing
Review: I love this product I’ve bought the shampoo conditioner the milk quench and the styler as well only used it this morning after I got out the shower and let me tell y’all I have been using the wrong products before mine you I’ve been using shampoo and conditioner for people how have straight hair and it damaged my wavy curls so I decided to finally repair the damage I did on my hair after this first use it’s amazing as you can see in the picture my curls are slowly be forsure coming back I haven’t had my curls like this in a long time it’s always either puffy with no curls or just no curls and sad so I’m so amazed with theses products will be buying again

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Clean & simple on 4C
Review: Shampoo + conditioner + hair milk = for me extreme coils!  I would recommend to barely use the hair milk it’s very oily lotion but keeps your scalp wet and moist. Over 1-2 hours the hair/curls is dry looking as in no shine and brittle to touch. Overall - hair is very soft and tangle free. I am looking for a more two strand hair twist approach to make waves so I will not use the milk as it creates coils and shrinkage.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Smells good - that's about it
Review: I wanted to like this so I gave this a month try...This did nothing for my curls but made them smell good... the shampoo left my scalp feeling unclean and the conditioner was weak... maybe this works for "wavy/straight" hair but I don't see how this could work for us heavy curled folk.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Scam?
Review: The item spilled (both conditioners) they smell nothing like my previous shampoo and conditioner. To top it off, the shampoo seems to have been usedI don’t recommend this seller or their products, feels like a scam. Wish I took proper photos before washing them, but even the bottle caps had some of the goo in closed spaces looking like it was possibly used.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Not the best out there but works in a pinch
Review: About 2 years ago, I began using the curly girl method on my hair and stopped using heat of any kind. Unfortunately, many of the natural shampoos and conditioners can be quite expensive, so I like to purchase this brand shampoo from time to time. Other reviews were stating this shampoo made their hair hard to comb, but using this with some kinky curly knot today conditioner made my 2c/3a curls soft and manageable. I lightly dry my hair and scrunch argan and jojoba oil into my hair for an easy wash and go style. This shampoo is great if you're on a budget or just to hold you over until you can buy a more expensive brand. It's not the best out there for sure, but it works. It smells pretty good and works better on my hair than devacurl, to be honest.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Ugh....
Review: Looooved the feeling of putting this drugstore suntan lotion smelling goop on my head. Soooooo great. The frizzy tangled rat's nest that replaced my awesome natural finger waves is SUCH a welcome change. 💀

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: My hair went from wavy to curly
Review: I have rheumatoid arthritis and after starting a new medication (Rinvoq) I noticed my hair was turning curly. My hair is now like it was when I was 3-4 yrs old. Most of my life I had either straight with some wave or just frizzy hair. I love my hair being curly but had to find a shampoo to help support that. This shampoo as well as the other products that go with it are amazing. My hair is now thick and curly!

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Great shampoo
Review: I bought this by mistake thinking it was the curl milk but honestly I like this shampoo more than my other one. It’s great and light but does the job. This brand also has way nicer stuff that could be better for your hair personally this is a go to. Also I get so many compliments on the smell of my hair

Title: Amazing stuff!
Review: This product smells so good. I love anything coconut because of it’s nourishing benefits. My hair is so soft and silky after using this. I have fine hair, and I’m older, so I try to protect it from damage. This gives it so much moisture! Follow up with the vanilla Bean conditioner and oh my goodness!

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz

I have a lot of different textures to my head from 2A to 4B so I decided to test the product out on my cousins hair first. They have 4B/4C high porosity hair and it cleaned their hair well without leaving it super dry. I had hoped it would do the same for mine. However, it did not. It left my hair dry and brittle and I lost tons of hair and left my hair squeaky clean. I was very disappointed.

Title: Smells divine & works great
Review: I'm really pleased with shampoo.  I didn't know what formula to buy since my hair seemed to fit none of the categories they describe on the bottle, but I ended up choosing the one for curly hair.  My hair is normally wavy to slightly curly but lately it had been flat and droopy.  I have long hair.  Since I've been using this shampoo, my hair is easier to brush even days after washing it.  It doesn't get dirty as quickly any more, either.  The shampoo smells like paradise.  My hair is softer, shinier & has a lot more volume using this shampoo.  It's super thick & somewhat hard to get out of the bottle.  I will continue using this brand but I may experiment with some of the other formulas to see how they are.  Overall, I really like it a lot.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Never again for my hair!
Review: Curl Quench more like Curl Coat... 😕I usually use Hask Curl Care with Honey shampoo and conditioner and my hair springs beautifully. I have very long, very thick, 3C curls that absolutely love the Hask shampoo & conditioner. But I thought I'd try something new and picked up some of this at a competing brick and mortar store.Within two washings it was obvious that this stuff does not do the same job. Now my curls are limp, my roots are flat, and I need a massive amount of hair lotion after I get out of the shower to tame the frizz. I used to only put a tiny amount of hair lotion in after showering to help keep the frizzies at bay! Not only am I severely disappointed with how this product has performed for me, but I realize that its costing me more as well because I have to use more than the Hask Curl S&C to get my hair clean, and to spread the conditioner through this massive amount of hair. For some reason this Maui stuff is stupid thick! So thick that it's hard to drag through my hair, and takes longer to rinse out. And then I have to use more hair lotion afterwards because of the frizz issue, also eating into my pocketbook that much more.Scent-wise, both products I compared smell nice, but I did prefer the scent of the Hask over this Maui. However if the Maui performed better, the scent of the Hask wouldn't have been enough alone for me to switch back.Plain and simple, when comparing to Hask curl products, Hask wins hands-down! I do not like the Maui curl products because they weigh my hair down, do not keep frizz away,  and are so ridiculously thick that they are hard to work through my hair.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Trust me! It's amazing!
Review: Here is the truth. I am a product snob. I buy and try everything it's genuinely a joke.I was paying for the huge bottles of Pureology and my hair dresser was constantly giving me "moisture treatments" because my hair was so brittle and dry.This shampoo and its sister conditioner is so great for my hair it's ridiculous.Not kidding, I found this product and used it daily on my highlighted and color treated hair (which I pay a small fortune for) and my hair dresser was amazed! It leaves my hair so soft and I don't need anti frizz product. I have fine hair but a lot of it it. It's also pretty straight with a little curl that gets frizzy. The moisture is incredible. I'm not getting paid for this review.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Wanted to love it
Review: Can’t help but automatically love a shampoo with no garbage in it and that doesn’t test on animals. BUT after using this shampoo and conditioner combo for the length of time that it took to finish the bottles (3 months or so), it sucks.Darn.I wanted to like this so badly but it leaves my hair feeling like candle wax. It’s knotty and rough feeling. Not smooth and silky by any means.One thing it does do is add volume, but I think that volume is all just build-up. I switched to Bed Head and it removed all the stuff this left behind.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Shampoo to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Shampoo, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Never again.
Review: While the product itself smelled good and I had high hopes for it my hair color was legitimately stripped by this. It is incredibly frustrating as based on the ingredients this should have been a color-safe product. My silvery blue hair now has a less than pleasant pastel mint green tone to it which is going yo be incredibly costly to fix.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have very fine, super super frizzy hair with on the top. Anything super heavy will weight my hair down and my scalp turns into a grease pit. I love how what this shampoo and conditioner duo does for my thin hair. My hair felt so soft right out the shower and it detangles so easily. I’ve tried many shampoos/conditioners before but this is by far my favorite brand. I actually used the chart that Maui Moisture had to determine which kind is suitable for me. I picked the curl quench coconut oil and it’s in the middle range for moisture level but don’t be fooled on how moisturizing this duo is. I think this is amazing considering I paid 30 plus for other terrible brands.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Hair loss And ruined pattern like deva curl
Review: Curly girls, if you have heard anything about the recent Deva Curl issues, stop using this brand too. I was using this conditioner exclusively as a conditioner and a leave in for my curls. It was amazing a year and a half ago, since then I have lost SO MUCH HAIR. Especially around my hair line. I’m talking chunks of hair in the shower. My sister started using the product about a year ago and when I told her she said the same thing. My hair was so thick y’all. It’s thin now. My curls won’t last longer than one day. If I sleep on them, forget about it. Please stop using this. I don’t know what the next product is but this is garbage. Look it up on the ThinkDirty app

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Stay AWAY if you DONT want to lose hair!!
Review: I don't write comments but I have to on this garbage! They use to use non toxic ingredients 4 years ago but now it's gone down the drain, just like my hair!!. I lost so much hair due to postpartum and I was so happy I finally got my hair back, until I switched hair products and started using Maui Moisture again. When I started using them I noticed my hair was coming out in chunks!!! I regret trying these curly products again. They contain Diazolidinyl Urea, DMDM and Iodopropynyl Butylcarbamate. Two of these ingredients are Formaldehyde Releasers and the other is a toxic preservative that’s used in paint and wood industries. Please stay away. Don't take the risk its so not worth it.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Beware, does the opposite of what it claims.
Review: I gave this products use for until I finished it which took about 1 month and 1 week. I have naturally curly hair, around 3B/3C hair and my biggest issue is my hair tends to be on the dry side so I need the products I use to moisturize, and reduce frizz. This product dried out my hair, caused so much frizz my curls lasted hrs and then got so tangled it was horrible to manage. When I try a product I go all out. I tried all together, the shampoo and conditioner, the curl smoothie and the curl milk. Now my hair is falling out in clumps. I have changed products to the one i used previously which was ogx coconut Curls until my hair is better to try another one. The problem I have with OGX is that the products make my hair greesy. The complete opposite problem. Beware when using this product as it does the opposite of what it intends. I ignored the bad reviews, and I regret it.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: I'm shocked at the good reviews.
Review: I have thick, course, curly hair. I bought this to moisturize and tame my hair. I have to say I'm shocked at the good reviews. When brushing out after using the first time, I was horrified at the amount of hair that came out of my head. CLUMPS of hair!!! Then when my hair dried, it was like straw. I am returning.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Curly hair
Review: I got the curl quench, I have 3a/3b and I love it. Smells great and leaves my hair soft.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Smells great but very drying
Review: I have thick curly hair that is pretty low maintenance.  My current conditioner has been out of stock for a few months and I’ve run out of my own stock so I tried this as a replacement.  I’ve used this for 5 days and my hair feels like straw.  My 4yr old also has curly hair so I used it on her this morning to see if it was specific to my hair, it wasn’t. I normally use Baby Organics on her hair and when I used this, her hair felt dry as well.  This smells great but it is not a fit for me

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Feeling like it’s stripping and tangling my hair.
Review: I have 4a long, curly hair. It’s not overly dry, but enough to need more moisture from conditioners. This, however, was not the way to go for me. I got the regular’ole conditioner. AS SOON as it touches my hair it feels like it’s STRIPPING it, not moisturizing it. Not to mention it makes my hair even harder to detangle because it’s not creamy and moisturizing. I’ve tried it a handful of times now and it’s dissatisfying. The smell is verrrrrry strong; too strong for me. It’s not awful, but it is a punch in the face lol. I’m wondering if the result of this conditioner is because of the kind I got? Instead of the quencher I think I’ll try the leave-in conditioner from this brand. If you like a weightless feel in your hair and don’t already struggle to detangle your hair, you’d probably like this. But if you want to FEEL the moisturization and help with detangling, this ain’t it.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Smells great but very drying
Review: This conditioner is really bad. It makes my curls feel like straw, and it seems to encourage my hair to tangle. It smells amazingly good, but I can't give it more than one star because it feels I have actively damaged my hair by trying this product. And anyway, why does it have so many different types of alcohol in the ingredient list? I bought this because it was advertised as silicone-free, but I compared the label to a conditioner I already had on hand that does have silicones-- this one has more ingredients containing alcohol than that one does. I've done enough reading up on curly hair to know it's not accurate to consider all alcohols as drying, but since this literally does not condition my hair at all, I think these ingredients must be part of the problem. Weird and bad.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Different Ingredients
Review: Don't order hair products off of amazon. I knew it was risky but I thought maybe it would work out. Nope. The ingredients list on this product was completelyyyyyyy different from the ingredient list on the actual Maui Moisture website. Disappointed.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Awesome smell(coconut), consistency, and effects on my hair!
Review: I am new to caring for my naturally curly hair. My hair has 2b, 2c, and 3a curls. I recently had protein/product overload which I got from adding to many protein boosting products in my hair. Long story short: I got brittle hair. I was looking for a protein free conditioner and found this one. This product has a lot of slip which is great for detangling. I absolutely love how it smells and helps my hair come back to being soft and silky. Definitely recommend this product but just a warning, IT LEAKS! So when you take it somewhere, make sure you put it in a plastic baggy. I am gonna buy this again for sure!

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Super rich conditioner for curls
Review: I've been using the styling cream for a while now, and loved it, so I wanted to try the conditioner. It's amazing! So rich. My hair tends to eat conditioners for breakfast and be hungry for more by lunch, especially in the dry winter months, so this is perfect. My hair has a great volume too, so it's not greasy, just creamy and thick and rich. My hair feels less frizzy, too. This is my new winter conditioner. The smell is a little strong, but I like coconut and it dissipates pretty fast.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Good at first
Review: I enjoyed this product at first, it really seemed to do right for my curls.  A couple of weeks using it my hair started thinning and it no longer worked for my curls.  Won't buy again.  I also do not use any other products on my hair and I don't use any heat

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Better than the high dollar stuff the salons sell for a fraction of the cost!
Review: I used to pay big bucks for a salon product that was supposed to moisturize my naturally curly hair,  but what it did was dry out my scalp and ultimately my hair. It got so dehydrated that my stylist even accused me of incorrectly coloring my own hair. I accidentally found this in the grocery store one day, knew I  had nothing to lose, so decided to try it.  It's been my conditioner of choice ever since. My hair is soft, but never oily, easy to style either with big manageable waves, or tight curly curls!  As long as Maui is available, you'll never catch me spending $35-$50 on conditioner again!

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: It does what it says it does - fabulous product
Review: I have been using very high-priced hair products for years. I needed an inexpensive conditioner to mix with Epson salt as an experimental cleansing solution. Walking through the store I found it on sale at the fraction of the cost of those expensive products. I was not expecting much since it was so cost saving, but I was so surprised at how fabulous it made my hair! My hair was so much softer and it enhanced my curls, as it said it would. No more high-priced professional products for me. I've been using it for about 3 months. Great product!!

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Conditioner that leaves hair feeling like it's freshly shampooed
Review: So, I shampoo my hair most days and condition it with leave-in conditioners. For rinse-out conditioners like this one, I first brush my (thick, coarse) hair, and apply the conditioner to it while it's dry. I run it all the way through my hair, saturating it from root to tip using only my fingers, then wrap it up into a towel and let it set for at least an hour. I then jump into the shower and rinse it out. I do this, generally, about once or twice a week. Doing this process with this conditioner left it feeling really clean and really good, like I'd just shampooed it with its matching shampoo, and that's not something I can say about many of the conditioners I've used.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Sufficiant
Review: This is a good conditioner but I started using another out of necessity and my hair is nicer with the other one. Its really good for super curly hair, but if you have wavy or loser curls it won't work for you.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Terrible Shipping Conditions
Review: The product itself is pleasant and smells great. I’ve used it before and it makes my hair soft. However, I’m rating it badly because of the condition this product came in. I ordered the shampoo AND conditioner. The conditioner was spilling out all over the box and on the bottle (as you can see in the picture). The shampoo is completely fine and is wrapped up. The conditioner was not wrapped up. This is the second time that I ordered this conditioner and the product was leaking out. The shampoo was in great condition and there was no leak from that bottle. I recommend getting the shampoo, but getting the conditioner from Walmart or somewhere similar in-person if you don’t want leakage.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Great Product
Review: I really am falling in love with Maui hair products. I was using a lot of Cibu products on my hair. I wanted to try a product that is affordable, convenient, and a great product. Maui has all these aspects. I really like the curly shampoo & conditioner option, it really helps my curly hair come back to life. It gives my hair a nice smoothness, and helps with frizz also, which I love. It also is available in CVS stores and probably other convenient stores too. If I were you I would give Maui hair products a try!

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Might cause hairloss
Review: At first I really liked this. It smelled good and left my hair feeling moisturized and full with my curls looking great. But then I started to notice that when I comb my hair after using it I loose and ungodly amount of hair. This might be unfair and if male pattern badness is too blame I will update accordingly.

My hair is normal thickness and curly but not super curly.Very disappointed.It may work better on Afro-American type of hair, which is really thick and really curly.Not for me.

Title: No better than Tresemme or Garnier
Review: Idk if it is just me or what, but this product isn't as great as the first time I used it. I bought a bottle from Target a few months ago because the packaging was cute and it said it was for "thick, curly hair" (I have 3B/3C hair for those that hair type). I was skeptical but OMG!! It worked so well. It was super thick and creamy and it left my hair feeling super soft and moisturized. I used it as a leave-in/styler. However, I recently ordered 3 bottles online through amazon and I just don't like the product anymore. To me it just does not feel like it is the same product. It isn't as thick or creamy and the consistency is more like Tresemme :/There's nothing wrong with Tresemme, but I could buy a bigger bottle for a cheaper price if that's what I wanted.I have since used 2 of the 3 bottles and I am just NOT impressed. I gave it 3 stars because it smells good but it is just like any other conditioner now. I know a lot of brands that claim to cater to thick and curly hair are changing their formulas to appeal to people with looser hair textures. I hope this isn't the case for this brand because I was a faithful customer after my first bottle. However, I don't think I'll be getting these anymore since it does nothing more than what a Tresemme conditioner could do.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: PURE GARBAGE
Review: 0 stars! This is the worst product I’ve ever used. It leaves my hair so tangled, knotty, course and dry that I cannot comb through it! And when I finally do I’ve lost clumps of hair. The worst part is that my hair doesn’t even feel clean after I’ve used it. I can’t run my fingers through it because it feels so greasy and matted down. How in the world is this marketed to moisturize hair? Suave for 0.99 does a way better job! The packaging is terrible too. The shape of the bottle paired with the thickness of the product makes it so difficult to dispense. It does smell good (its only saving grace) but the scent doesn’t last beyond the shower. Disappointing is an understatement.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Made my curls limp, frizzy and dry
Review: I picked this up at CVS but I'm leaving a review here because I often use my amazon app to gauge how good a product is before i buy it.While using this system my curls felt like straw. They were frizzer than normal (which is saying something) and my curls were loose almost wavy when I normally have medium/tight curls. Ive used about half of the bottles I purchased and Ive given up. I can't justify putting my hair through this just not to waste the money spent on this product.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Great product...without sulfates or silicone!
Review: It is a challenge finding products without sulfate or silicone that also address the need to moisturize and protect hair effectively. This is a wonderful product, particularly for curly hair. Smells delicious! However, it is surprising that it is less than half the price at Target. I will continue to purchase this product, as well as continue to recommend to colleagues and friends!

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Very easy to use and smells wonderful.
Review: I love everything about this product. I like how my hair feels. I like how easy it is to style my hair. The smell is amazing. It's not at all oily or greasy to the touch after it's applied. I'm going to get them all.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Not what it seems
Review: I wanted to try this product again and figured that curl quench would help my thick curly hair find the moisture it needs. Again, another let down. I was so hoping this product was going to work but it leaves my hair feeling even more drier than it is lately due to the cold weather. I figure they put fancy ingredients to make it seem like it would work better. It's not any better than the commercial products. Nothing special about it. So disappointed.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: The best
Review: I've been using this conditioner for about 6 months now. I absolutely love it. Nothing has moisturized my hair, and reduced the frizzy curls like this has. And it's so much cheaper on here than where I generally buy it. 10/10 would recommend to everyone with curly hair.Pictures don't show just how much this conditioner has helped my hair!

However, there was something about this conditioner that I didnt find appealing: it wasnt thick enough for me. It seemed thin. This isn't a bad conditioner but it would not be my first pick. I would say it comes in second behind Aussie Moisture.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have very fine, super super frizzy hair with on the top. Anything super heavy will weight my hair down and my scalp turns into a grease pit. I love how what this shampoo and conditioner duo does for my thin hair. My hair felt so soft right out the shower and it detangles so easily. I’ve tried many shampoos/conditioners before but this is by far my favorite brand. I actually used the chart that Maui Moisture had to determine which kind is suitable for me. I picked the curl quench coconut oil and it’s in the middle range for moisture level but don’t be fooled on how moisturizing this duo is. I think this is amazing considering I paid 30 plus for other terrible brands.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Perfect
Review: Works great!!

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Very Moisturizing
Review: I started using this line while going through a major hair transition. I started struggling with my 3c hair two years ago at 21 and at 23 I decided to change up my shampoo and conditioner after using SheaMoisture for 6 years. The immediate result was less damaged ends, but my hair texture absolutely changed from 3c to 3A. I thought it could be due to the heaviness of the conditioner so I switched to their Flaxseed conditioner and found it restored the definition of my curls while still massively hydrating. My one critique of this product is that it can lead to buildup when using ONLY the for thick curly hair system. I suggest clarifying with one of their stronger shampoos every two or three washes because the shampoo is very weak. I personally like the hibiscus (pink bottle) for clarifying.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Amazing product
Review: I love what this is able to do to my hair, it really makes it smell like I just came out of Hawaii and couldn't be more pleased with the scent. But due to my hair extremely high porosity, it is harder for it to absorb the moisture.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Lose Hair & Moisture
Review: Please listen to the low star reviews!!!! It smells good but that’s the only good thing about this. I am not sure if the formula changed or what but this absolutely did the opposite of what it claims. My hair couldn’t get detangled or moisturized so matter how much or little I used. I lost so much hair I was literally crying, I never seen so much of my hair lost while conditioning or detangling. I felt that I was better off using a shampoo. It made my hair so thin.

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: El acondicionador es una belleza, tengo cabello ondulado pero cuando se reseca siempre se me pone lacio y con frizz, usando este no he tenido ningún problema ni siquiera en tiempos de frío, y al contrario está suave y sedoso y hasta he notado que es más grueso. El aroma es muy rico y con muy poquito te alcanza para todo el cabello. También lo he usado disuelto en agua en un atomizador para hidratar las puntas de mi cabello los días que no me lo lavo y funciona de maravilla, no lo deja grasoso y quita el frizz. Lo único es que si tienes muy poco cabello o muy finito podría dejártelo pesado como dicen otras reseñas, pero fuera de eso 100% recomendado

Product: Maui Moisture Curl Quench + Coconut Oil Curl-Defining Anti-Frizz Conditioner to Hydrate and Detangle Tight Curly Hair, Softening Conditioner, Vegan, Silicone & Paraben-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: Le pongo 3 estrellas no porque sea un mal producto, si no porque a mi cabello le callo muy mal. Huele delicioso y recien lavado deja el cabello muy suave, pero al secarse deja una sensacion grasosa en el cabello y el dia siguiente se ve como pajoso. Creo que debe haber quienes tengan mejores resultados usando este producto pero a mi no me quedó bien.
