Title: Great product
Review: So first off I think a lot of people giving this product bad reviews is because they are uneducated about sulfate free shampoo. You can't just go from using normal shampoo like Pantene or shampoo that has sulfate in it to these organic sulfate free shampoos. There is a transition period your hair needs to go through first. When first switching your hair may feel oily and like straw it may look terrible and even fall out. That's because in the normal shampoos you are using, the chemicals coat your hair making it appear healthy and shiny. In reality underneath the hair is damaged and being stripped of its natural oils. When you use a product like Maui for the first time there's no chemicals hiding the damage to your hair. So your hair looking so bad after using these products is because that's how your hair really is! Your hair may start falling out because now that your scalp is breathing for the first time it's trying to dump the dead damaged hair to make way for new hair to grow. When making a switch you need to give it a few weeks at least which is not easy because your hair may look like crap. I say may because it depends on what shampoos you were using previously. Other chemical products play a role as well. Organic shampoo does not have all the harsh chemicals in it so it's hard for it to wash chemicals out. So if your using hair gel and spray and whatever else on your hair that has the ingredient silicone in it then washing with a sulfate free shampoo your gona get build up in your hair. So if your new to these types of shampoos you really need to do some research first because they may be an amazing product but you hate it because you are not using it the right way. Most people after they get through the transition period say their hair ever looked so beautiful and they would never go back.That being said I bought this shampoo and conditioner from walmart which was way cheaper than on amazon. Most organic shampoos don't lather well but this one latheres great. It smells great and feels light on my hair. When It Drys my hair is super shiny and bouncy. I am really pleased with this especially for the price. The conditioner I needed to use kind of a lot for my hair cuz it is thick and the conditioner is very thin but I have that problem with most conditioners. I love this shampoo though and highly recommend

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Literally Fried My Hair; Do Not Buy
Review: I've been looking for more organic hair products recently, and have been familiar with Maui products for some time. I love their curl smoothie, and use it daily after my showers. I co-wash, so having a good conditioner is vital to my routine. I needed to replace my conditioner so I thought, why not? Let's try their wash out conditioner.WORST MISTAKE EVER.To be clear, I do not have excessively dry or frizzy. My hair is typically smooth and brushes easy, so long as I only shampoo once a week.After using this product once, my hair was literally fried. It was dry, brittle, and tangled easily. I could not get a brush through. I had to buy detangler! DETANGLER! I haven't needed that since I was SIX. It took two weeks of intensive hair masks (every other day) before my hair has returned to a normal, healthy state. Not only did it destroy my hair, but it left a thick residue that was difficult to wash out. It took two hours of rising, detangling, brushing, repeat, until I literally gave up and left the house in a hat to buy hair masks. I cannot stress this enough- this conditioner is NOT Girls with Curls Approved. I've never been his disappointed in a hair care product.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Yuck
Review: I did not buy from here but…honestly i have NEVER used a conditioner as bad as this. I survived through the shea butter one. It smelled nice! The coconut one made my hair mat and I could pull big clumps of matted hair right out of my head. It was matted badly. I immediately changed to redkin and z day later.. no more MESS. I felt i had to share. I have black naturally curly hair. This was awful!! I use biologe oil shampoo and pricy redkin. For a reason!!

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: GREAT for dry hair!
Review: I paid $6.50 for each bottle in this line (I got shampoo, conditioner and the spray oil) hoping for the best but not expecting much. In full disclosure, I also bought Ultra-Swim shampoo to get a good clarifying cleanse before starting this since google searching told me that switching from sulfates to natural cleansers takes a bit of an adjustment that I wanted to avoid (and supposedly my city water has chlorine added so I figured it couldn't hurt to use this stuff.) I did have to shampoo with that Ultra-Swim about 3 times in a row before getting a good suds worked up, but then I got a great suds from this shampoo and realized to my amazement that I could actually run my fingers through my hair during this shampoo stage! Normally I shampoo up, rinse it out, then condition and run my fingers through it to get all the loose hair out--I simply can't run my fingers through UNTIL adding conditioner. Not with this! I was running my fingers through it and through it and through it, amazed at the feeling! The conditioner was just as "luxurious"...there's no other word for it!I have since washed with just these 2 and I don't get the VAST amount of suds from that first wash, but that's not surprising...I probably would if I shampooed 3 times like I did that first time (but it's not necessary now.) I still get a lot of suds and that conditioned feeling, though. I MIGHT could go without the conditioner and use only the moisturizing shampoo, but my hair is super dry so I won't even try. I haven't had any adjustment period to this (again, could be because of the Ultra-Swim clarification?) What REALLY got me was that google-searching mentioned scratching your head and getting "dead skin cells" under your nails (which I totally did) but then they said it was actually the sulfates left over...and sure enough, I don't get that under my nails now! I love this stuff!!!! And I only wash my hair every 3 days, so it will last me a LONG time! I even brought some travel sizes to work to share with a couple of friends, and they're in love, too! But if you don't have dry hair, this is NOT the product for you!

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Great, but much cheaper in stores.
Review: This is a great smelling and feeling shampoo/conditioner. A little bit goes a long way, too, which is important to me because I have very thick hair. I won't be buying here because it's twice the price it is in the store. I got it at Walmart for like, 6 something.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Wonderful products!
Review: This product is amazing! I picked it up at my local beauty supply. I’ve used this line before and it is just as fantastic as I remember. First off this collection is perfect for all hair types but mostly dry, damaged, coarse textured hair. My hair is naturally Indian hair and it works wonders considering my hair was previously bleached. I wanted to switch to a silicone free shampoo and conditioner because I’m trying to get my hair back to healthy and I don’t want wax on my hair weighing it down. So I threw out my previous shampoo because it had so many chemicals including wax.  Relatively inexpensive and works really well. Would definitely recommend!

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Burns hair follicles. Permanent baldness.
Review: Maui Moisture burns your hair follicles with formaldehyde causing PERMANENT baldness.Once the follicles are damaged you will forever be baled— causing Alopecia.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Hairstylist review!
Review: I have highlighted hair, healthy. Very thick no curls.. I’m also a cosmetologist. I love with two other females one with curly normal hair, the other extremely thin and fine and curly. On my hair it was AWFUL.. the smell is amazing .. I give them that.. we have tried three separate ones, all the same company. On the curly regular hair It was average.. and on thin hair it worked well. The deep conditioner was terrible on my hair and very fine hair. Worked well on normal/curly hair. I don’t recommend as a stylist. (I don’t recommend most over the counter shampoos, but sometimes it’s necessary) for fine hair is not terrible. Didn’t like it. The body was however, we all liked that!

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: a+
Review: Just got this shampoo in addition to the conditioner and it's amazing! I recently bleached my hair and while it wasn't fried or breaking off, it was definitely feel a little lifeless and this product helped my hair a lot. It feels soft and has body now. I also love that this company doesn't use harsh chemicals either.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: This made my hair fall out.
Review: This made my hair worse. I have 3C type hair and wanted something that would hydrate my curls for a little extra umph. Well this was not it.  I read reviews and got a pretty even split so I decided to try it out.The packaging is nice and it smells good. It lathers well and feels nice in my hair.  After I rinsed my hair it was obvious that my hair was different. So much that my husband look at me and asked why my curls were straight.This took the elasticity out of most of my curls and left my hair feeling dry. The curls I did have left we're super frizzy.The worst part was that my hair now sheds like CRAZY! This made my hair fall out.Try at your own risk.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: 2.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This seemed so great at first.  The smell was wonderful.  The lather was great.  My hair felt clean and shiny.Fast forward a month later.  My hair is dull and looks greasy all the time.  It's dried out and snarls constantly.  I hate what this does to your hair after a few washes.  For the record, I never change shampoos before I go through a whole bottle (and I had a small one) but it was so bad I threw out the shampoo and two bottles of conditioner.It got two stars for smell onlyFor comparison sake: my hair is long, very straight, and fine.  I've switched to Paul Mitchell's tea tree shampoo and noticed an improvement right away, but I think the damage done will take some time to repair.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Good shampoo
Review: As described. I was looking for an affordable, accessible shampoo that is sulfate free. It has a unique smell. Not a bad one but I can understand why some people might not be into it. Has been working well for me even with my major dry scalp issues in the winter.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: shine and coaxed out stubborn curls
Review: I have stubborn, mixed texture hair ever since a hormonal event — the back is wavy, the front and sides are quite straight. The mask teased out the curls in a way that high end products (eg Aveda) have not! My hair is not overly dry or curly so I cannot speak to this for those in need of something more intense. I thought the consistency was not hydrating enough in shower but happy the next day.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Disappointed
Review: I actually found and purchased this at Target. I tried it today to try and make the switch from Pantene. I'll be making an exchange later because not only did it make my hair feel weird and not very clean but it also somehow made my hair fall out in clumps and it stripped my hair of its color (dyed 2 weeks ago with box color). Smells great. Packing looks good. But that's not exactly worth my hair falling out and losing my color. Also, it's not exactly a big bottle and I've got long hair so I'd go through the bottle in about a month or 2.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Excellent
Review: SO GLAD I tried this on a whim. It is delicate, yet really cleans, and leaves my hair feeling lovely. Soft, smooth, manageable. I have a lot of fine hair, stick straight (unless I sleep with it wet.) Chemically treated. This is the best over-the-counter shampoo and conditioner I've found for my chemically treated hair. Love it. I used to use Pureology and recently considered the similarly expensive Living Proof shampoo/condition. Save your money.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Looks/smells/feels nice but caused hair loss
Review: I purchased this to use on my daughter's curly hair.  Pros: Great smelling, felt moisturizing, as her curls felt soft after washing.  Cons:  Made her hair start falling out.  I thought nothing of it at first, assuming it was because her hair had been in braids most of the week and this was just normal comb out.  But the same thing happened the next two weeks and I realized it started when we bought this.  Washed her hair last week with her previous brand, and barely any hair fall.  It's a shame because otherwise this was nice, but didn't work for us.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Smooth, Relaxed, Repaired, Moisturized, Detangeled and Shiny Hair ........
Review: I found this Shampoo and it's Conditioner by chance. What got me to try it out was that the first ingredient is 100%  Aloe Vera Juice and not water like all the others; however, water is the 2nd ingredient. During the first wash, I immediately noticed that it softened and relaxed my hair while lathering and detangled it right away. After the first use, my hair was very soft, relaxed and shiny! It makes a great duo with the matching conditioner. The product has a "coolness" to it, which I am sure is due to the Aloe Vera Juice. Also, with natural ingredients and no harsh chemicals makes this a healthy choice for your hair! I highly recommend. Just wished it came in larger quantities! It has a nice subtle fragrance which doesn't hold strong in the hair, but that is the least of my concerns when it comes to hair care.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Not bad enough to throw out, but definitely won't buy again
Review: My hair is fine with a bit of natural wave to it - thought with all the good reviews, this shampoo would add moisture to my hair, which is becoming dryer as I get older.  Instead it leaves it flat and feeling greasy.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Best Conditioner
Review: I have 3B fine curly hair. I really love this conditioner. It moisturizes my hair, detangles it, and when I wash it out my hair is softer. It is one of the best and affordable conditioners out there. I used to use DevaCurl One Condition Decadence but once I ran out, I switched to this because it is more affordable and just as good.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: fantastic and cheap.
Review: Best product i've tried for my beard. bought as impulse and am glad i did. used it this morning and my beard has never been so soft. smells good too. i'm going to stock up in case they realize they're selling it too cheap.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Shampoo to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz

It stinks so bad it gave me a headache, they need to get rid of the extremely strong "fragrance" they're putting in this. Also made my hair feel heavy and greasy. Will return product, its gross. Do not recommend especially for my hair type.

Title: Love the shampoo! First ingredient is Aloe!
Review: I bought this shampoo originally at CVS and instantly feel the difference in my hair and scalp. What made me take a chance on this product is that the first ingredient is aloe and aloe is known to have healing and healthy effects on the skin surface. This product also does not have silicone, parabens, and sulfates!  This is helpful since I color my thick hair and my scalp tends to be on the dry side, however after using the shampoo only once my hair feels softer and my scalp isn't as dry anymore. I would go back to either CVS or local grocery store since the cost here on Amazon is double the store price.

Title: Maui "Moisture" Shampoo strips your hair and dries it out.
Review: It has some good ingredients in it, but the shampoo ultimately strips your hair of all natural oils and moisture, opposite of what it's intended for. It's so very harsh that even the ingredients to help moisturize, are ultimately washed right out, completely. The Maui Moisture Conditioner and Deep Conditioner however, are not bad products for moisturizing hair. But the shampoo will strip your hair and dry it right out. You'll even notice it feels like you're washing your hair with harsh detergent dish soap.

Title: Verified Purchase
Review: había comprado estos productos en walmart y me gustaron mucho. el walmart está lejos de donde yo vivo y por cosas personales, no había tenido posibilidad de ir así que decidí comprarlos (3 shampoos y 3 enjuagues) por aquí, el paquete muy bien, nada derramado (se lo atribuyo a que el paquete venía lleno, no había posibilidad de que los shampoos/enjuagues se movieran) llegó el día de usarlos y de olor y consistencia es lo mismo, lo diferente fue el resultado. me dejó el pelo raro, ¡me rechinaba! y el acondicionador igual. pensé “tal vez mi pelo tiene que acostumbrarse”... lo seguí usando. diario. y nada más no. me pregunto si son originales o si están alterados?nota: sé que estos productos son libres de químicos pero mi pelo está acostumbrado a este tipo de productos, no es como que necesitara un detox o algo así.

Title: UGHHh
Review: I had high hopes for this after seeing reviews of it on here and YouTube. I thought I had finally found a cheap natural hair product, but a girl was wrong...again. It did not help my hair at all. I could not detangle with it and it left my hair feeling brittle and lifeless. I have hair from type 2A to 4B and it did nothing for me. My cousins have 4B-4C hair and it only worked on one of them.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Just okay
Review: I've been making a point of buying only paraben free, sulfate free shampoo and conditioner for the past year. I wish I could say I've finally found a really hydrating conditioner with this one, but it just does a very average job for me. I still have to comb a TON of argon oil through my hair after showering for it to be soft and nice. I like other attributes of the conditioner, like the smell and such, but hydration is the whole point, and it's not doing it. Too bad! I'd previously been using Avalon Organics Nourishing Lavender. I find this to be about the same in effectiveness, just less costly.For reference, my hair is colored, but not too dry.Also - not related to effectiveness - but it's challenging that the shampoo and conditioner bottles look exactly the same. I find it funny that there's nothing visually distinguishable between them. Haven't mixed them up; just funny.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Literally my favorite brand
Review: I cannot emphasize enough how amazing this brand is. Aloe as the first ingredient is the most amazing thing you can have in a skin or haircare product. Add to the fact they have coconut water in it too, and it's f over! And no silicone, sulfates, or parabens? Please! This could smell like toilet water and I'd buy it and mask it, but luckily all of their products truly smell like Maui; words don't do it justice, but it smells how having tropical sun kissed skin feels.Dramatics aside, you simply will not find a product (body wash, shampoo, or anything) better than they have for a better price. Not with the ingredient concentration and quality for sure. I look hella too like I'm obsessed- I actually have really bad (diagnosed) OCD.I literally never write reviews but I literally have like 5 of their products and am obsessed with getting more (I always have some waiting in my cart to get when I have extra money- right now I have 2) cause they're so good. I've been using really good products for awhile now and you can genuinely feel the quality and moisture in the consistency like this stuff is really good. Their body wash is exquisitely moisturizing and nourishing(and I got volcanic ash-the harshest one- and I mix it with a bha/aha wash that I v drying) and its the only body wash I've ever used where the smell actually lingers ON YOUR SKIN!!!I recommend this brand enthusiastically to all my friends and family, and I recommend it to anyone. Clearly get the right product for you, but this brand, and their base formula, is good for anyone and everyone.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I found this shampoo and conditioner by chance in a store and love, love, love it! I have noticed that my split ends have decreased since using it. So happy that I stumbled up this brand.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: HOLY GRAIL - Low porosity hair life saver!!!!
Review: I've tried so many products from Olaplex to every natural/sulfate free shampoo and conditioner to mend my super dry low porosity hair (I don't color, I barely use heat, but my ends get so dry and have breakage from previous keratin treatments) and within ONE wash - my hair literally went from feeling dead and dry from the neck down to being the softest and healthiest my hair has ever felt all the way down to my ends!!! It has so much life and movement - all the dryness and frizz are GONE. Literally can't believe the results for the price, it feels like my hair went through a $200 conditioning treatment I'm obsessed!!!!

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Awful and doesn’t condition the hair at all
Review: This is the worst waste of money. It is worse than putting soap in your hair. It is completely worthless and useless. This is the worst conditioner that I have ever used. It is not like conditioner at all. You may as well put soap in your hair. This so-called conditioner does not do anything to condition the hair. It leaves your hair dry and a mess. Your hair will be dryer and have knots after using this.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Amazing detangler for dry , coarse , ethnic hair.
Review: This is an excellent moisturizer. You’ll notice, it softens and detangles at the same time with the added bonus of smelling just amazing. I have long , natural , ethnic , thick hair that tends to dry out due to intense workouts , resulting in a lot of sweating and this has worked really well (a game changer) . After normal product use, my hair feels silky; I can literally comb through my thick hair with only my hands because it detangles and softens very well. I would highly recommend sectioning your hair and applying this product according to the instructions. I saw an immediate difference in the natural texture of my hair and couldn’t be happier. Big bonus: not greasy and no residue.Tip:Use in shower after washing your hair. Put this product on liberally , in sections , leave on about 2 minutes to let it work it’s magic, rinse out and enjoy the benefits. My hair is the driest around my nap so I apply liberally in my nap and hairline .  This clears the kinks. This is a thick product so turn the bottle upside down before using; it’s not watery so you may have to shake the bottle to get the product out.I learned of this product reading multiple reviews online , saw that it was sold on amazon and picked up 2 bottles. This is a staple in my house.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Finally found the perfect shampoo and conditioner
Review: I've been using this shampoo and conditioner for 3 months now, and I can finally say I've found what I've been looking for.My whole life, I've had super thick, coarse, kinky, dry hair that basically feels like you're brushing hay. That may be in part due to PCOS and some hormone imbalances caused by that, and I've tried all kinds of products over the years to make it feel even remotely moisturized. Everything either didn't improve the feel of my hair, cost WAY too much, or left my hair feeling greasy.Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate made my hair feel smooth and look shiny for the first time ever...while leaving it feeling light and fluffy. Yay no grease! I feel like I got a salon product at an actual reasonable price. Highly recommend.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Don't hesitate
Review: I had been using Tresemme shampoo and cheap conditioner for a while now and it's done nothing but damage my hair and leave residue. This is the first all natural product I've used and I'm in love!!! I paired this with the matching shampoo and the vanilla bean hair mask. I shampooed and then conditioned allowing it to sit for 10 minutes then rinsed, when I got out of the shower I used the mask as a leave- in product using a small amount on my damp hair. I allowed my hair to dry naturally. I have not seen my natural waves in months!!!! After just one use my hair feels like it's coming back to life. This is my new go too!!!!

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Love this!
Review: I've gone back and forth with so many different products for my dry and damaged hair and none of them gave me the results that this brand did! I bought the conditioner as well and it has made a huge difference. My hair is still dry, but definitely not as bad as it was. My frizz is pretty much gone, and my natural waves and curls have become so much more pronounced. I used to straighten my hair all of the time because I didn't like how my waves/curls looked, and now I don't straighten my hair! You end up only needing so little of this stuff to help your hair, it's amazing. I love the coconut scent, and my hair always feels so healthy after a wash. I highly recommend buying the conditioner with it for the best results. Will absolutely continue buying this when it comes time for more.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Love the Heal and Hydrate line
Review: I love the Heal and Hydrate shampoo and leave in conditioner! My hair is very long and fine in texture.  So many moisturizing products weigh my hair down but not these. They do a great job. When my hair was a lot shorter I really liked the heal and hydrate conditioner and mask but i find now that my hair is very long they don't quite add as much moisture as I need.  I use another brand's hair mask instead to condition after shampooing now. But the shampoo and leave in are holy grail status for me. Not a fan of any of the other Maui Moisture lines I have tried but the heal and hydrate are amazing.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: I finally got it RIGHT!
Review: My teen daughter is so picky about her hair products!!  She has "mixed" hair and it is very thick and curly.  She is very scent sensitive and very difficult to purchase anything for!  I took a chance and she is in LOVE with this.  The scent is light but pleasing.  Her curls are soft and shiny, very manageable!  She hates a stiff or a thick product and this is neither.  She was actually impressed I picked this out!  Definitely recommend!

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Maybe it's the formula
Review: I have bought and used Maui products before and had no problem with them doing what they say they do. My issue with this Maui product is that the smell is really strong almost like the product has been doused in alcohol and perfume strong. For a minute I thought maybe the seller did something to my product(product came unsealed) and that was the cause of the smell. I don't remember Maui smelling so loud. Overall, as I stated the product did do what it stated but the smell is strong.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: This is not Maui Moisture!
Review: BUYER BEWARE whatever is inside this bottle is not the correct product! I buy this at my grocery store as needed but due to the pandemic I decided to purchase on Amazon and save myself a trip. I know exactly what this scent should smell and feel like. The product inside the bottle smells and looks nothing like it should. I will never buy things like this from Amazon again. Too easily switched out for cheap knock-off products!

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Not what I expected....
Review: This is a great product but I was not fond of how it left my hair. I think it cleaned it too much and left my hair without moisture for me to feel its essence look I was expecting of this product. It is highly wonderfully scented with wonderful aromas it is to embrace and be mentally transported in sweet lands but for me does not do the job I was hoping for.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: A thick conditioner that smells amazing
Review: This shampoo is very moisture rich. For me, this isn’t the best for a shampoo because it makes my scalp oily pretty quickly. I will still use it because it smells so good! I like the conditioner better because it has the same smell. The conditioner is thick and it feels like it penetrates the hair better than lighter conditioners. I prefer the conditioner over the shampoo and I think the price is good for the quality of then product. I prefer this scent and product the most from this brand. However, I really do not like the deep conditioning masque in this same scent. It is terrible and makes my hair feel like I put something extremely cheap on my hair

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Works amazing!
Review: I love this and use it every time I shower. It has a great scent and really moisturizes my hair. I have curly hair, so it tends to be pretty dry. Not many conditioners make my hair look and feel this great!! The only problem is that it is hard to get out of the container. I just leave it upside down and that seems to work!

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Hair falling out!!
Review: I’m pretty positive this is making my hair shed, (falling out to the touch of anything. ) I have pretty thin hair and I just used this and bam my hair is shedding like NEVER before. Never. My husband too! And I’m pretty sure it’s making my face break out too from when my hair touches my face. I don’t think this is as great a product as it tries to come off as. Sadly.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: It dried out my hair even more than normal making it more brittle and frizzy
Review: Update:I tried using it at different amounts of product I used but the results were nearly the same with end result that my hair completely dried out and it took couple of weeks to restore my hair to natural state.I do not recommend this product.First impression:Smells good, it's nice and thick creamy.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Not a good product
Review: Used both conditioner and shampoo and it Made my hair feel hard and difficult to clear out. My hair didn’t feel moisturized. Not worth the buy

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Lives up to the hype
Review: Loved this product. Great conditioner and detangler. Takes away all the frizz and leaves my hair feeling silky and smooth. The scent is wonderful. Can’t say enough good things about this product.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: HATED this
Review: I was very excited to use this, I have straight hair, not damaged, just wanted to use a good shampoo, I read a lot of opinions and reviews and it seemed this was the best shot, the first time I used it I didn't understand why my hair was drying so bad, really really dry, horrible. I decided to give it another shot and it was the same thing, my hair was horrible after, I also used the shampoo of the same brand. I'm never using them again. I went back to my regular drugstore Dove and my hair is perfect.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz

Review: I’m not too fond of the scent (personal preference) but it’s a nice formula that doesn’t dry/dehydrate. The bottle design leaves a lot to be desired. It’s impossible to squeeze so you have to shake the product out, like ketchup.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Shiny curls! Good leave in spray option for non-greasy finish
Review: Made my curls so shiny! Not very soft or overly greasy but I like that. I do not pick up on a very strong scent, but I prefer that. Scented products clash with perfume. Good price for a leave in spray conditioner- will buy again.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Prepare to rinse for a while.
Review: Overall, this is a great conditioner. It smells amazing and feels really hydrating. My only issue is that, because it’s a thicker consistency, I feel like I have to stay under the shower head forever and a day to rinse all the conditioner off. Otherwise my hair feels thick, gross, and dirty. It’s not the worst problem to have but it is something to keep in mind.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Beware!! Not Actual Product!
Review: I buy and use this product regularly from the store and a few times on Amazon. The most recent one I bought from Amazon is NOT the real product! The consistency and smell were the first things I noticed were off. Each time I've used it my hair has been dry and frizzy and hard to brush. It looks awful! I love this conditioner but I will never buy this from Amazon again!

Review: I have lost an insane amount of hair since I started using this product.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz

Review: I had heard amazing things about the shampoo and conditioner duo. my hair has been very dry and dull lately so i thought this would help. unfortunately the results were underwhelming, my hair remained dull, dry and rough. was hoping for a better outcome will have to continue the search for a better product.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz

Title: Love the smell!

Title: Very disappointed

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: 10/10 do it
Review: I love this ! I’m so sad I didn’t try it sooner. I’ve been using high end color protecting shampoo for years , I took the plunge and cut my color off so I got this to use after my clarifying shampoo. It smells wonderful and makes my hair so soft. I want candles this scent

Title: Best hair products I've ever used
Review: My hair was brittle,lifeless, and snapping off. I needed a miracle product to help fix my hair and fast. I ordered the Maui shampoo, conditioner, and leave in conditioner and I'm blown away at how fast this product saved my hair. I'm hooked on this stuff now! The scent is incredible. It's got magical ingredients or something. For the price it's thee best product out there. It's unreal!

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Thumbs Up!
Review: My family loves it!  We had to buy more because we kept stealing it from one bathroom to the other.  Zaps the frizzies from our wavy hair and it smells great, too.  (For a few moments I pretend I'm at a vacay resort instead of heading back to the office.)

Review: I purchased based on the positive reviews, affordability and “natural” ingredients, but maybe it wasn’t meant for my hair type. It left my hair feeling dull, limp and dirty, as if I never gave my hair a good rinse. It actually did the opposite and made my hair even frizzier and harder to detangle. It smells really good! But the smell can be very overpowering and too perfumey. Disappointed in this product.

Title: Game changer

Title: Good for Men with curly hair

Title: Just give it a try
Review: It took my hair 3 washes to get used to this shampoo and conditioner. After the first wash, my hair felt like covered with oil. Definitely recommend it to anyone.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Have been using this line - shampoo, conditioner and hair mask for a week and a half. I normally use dove or tressame. Anyways this is the best I have used yet. Let’s just say my hair doesn’t fall out in the shower nor while combing it as much. I use it almost everyday. My hair is very curly and fine and this stuff makes a world of difference. My hair stays hydrated all day with the hair mask and the shampoo and conditioner makes it very soft. Needless to say I’ve ordered plenty to hold meOver. You also don’t need a lot of shampoo and a little goes a long way. And the conditioner either.

Title: great impulse buy
Review: i know this isn't geared toward me but i have a big beard and bought this on impulse. it works great and lasts all day. i spritz in on in the morning and it keeps my beard softer than the product i was using the last 18 months. i don't rinse it out.  can't believe how cheap it is. if anyone has a friend with a beard, recommend this. much cheaper than beard oil they may be using.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: Meh, just okay; it's not bad but it isn't  amazing, either
Review: I have used Maui Moist shampoos and conditioners for several months now. Maybe it's because my hair is so dry and curly ( as in telephone-cord curly), but in my experience, while this brand's shampoos and conditioners certainly do smell nice and are at least as good as any drugstore or supermarket- issued shampoo and conditioner, but I don't find this brand to be all that special in terms of  moisturizing unless I squirt a bunch of argan  oil or coconut oil into the bottle, which I  really shouldn't have to do if this product really did do what is purports to do, right? I mean, it's pretty good and it didn't dry out my scalp or make my hair spontaneously combust  or  fall out or anything drastic like that, and the smell is delicious enough that it keeps me coming back to the brand to buy more, so it certainly isn't terrible or anything, I  just think it should do a better job of moisturizing my hair.  Buying tip for any  savings-minded readers like me: I have only purchased the shampoo and conditioner on Amazon once; once in a local store in my little tiny  hometown in Michigan ; and  once  on eBay, and while it isn't cheap ( remember, this isn't some detergent-laden cheapie  shampoo like Pert or Suave or  whatever); it isn't really expensive, either (I once had a $40 shampoo-- it WAS amazing-- from Italy that I bought from a local  salon  here in Atlanta, but they are always out of it, and that is way out of my budget right now anyway. I found this brand  to cost less on eBay when bought as a shampoo/conditioner set, but of course, shipping with amazon prime is quicker and somewhat cheaper to ship than what one might find on eBay. So this isn't a bad deal, it actually is quite a bit better than buying it at a box store if you can find it (my local Target in Atlanta didn't even carry  this brand when  I  last visited there and wanted to stock up).So I'm back to buying it on Amazon, because I am running low on it and I'm going to want it sooner than later.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: GREAT for dry hair!
Review: I was searching for a "better" conditioner since I had JUST cut 2 inches off of my hair 6 weeks ago and it was ALREADY looking fried and dried despite not using any styling tools. I walked down the aisle at Walmart and realized that the conditioners all had water as the first ingredient and some type of alcohol as the second....even as I continued into the more and more expensive brands, they still had alcohol as the second ingredient! I determined that I would find SOMETHING without that drying alcohol ingredient (at least so far near the front) and came upon this.I paid $6.50 for each bottle (I got shampoo, conditioner and the spray oil) hoping for the best but not expecting much. In full disclosure, I also bought Ultra-Swim shampoo to get a good clarifying cleanse before starting this since google searching told me that switching from sulfates to natural cleansers takes a bit of an adjustment that I wanted to avoid (and supposedly my city water has chlorine added so I figured it couldn't hurt to use this stuff.) I did have to shampoo with that Ultra-Swim about 3 times in a row before getting a good suds worked up, but then I got a great suds from this shampoo and realized to my amazement that I could actually run my fingers through my hair during this shampoo stage! Normally I shampoo up, rinse it out, then condition and run my fingers through it to get all the loose hair out--I simply can't run my fingers through UNTIL adding conditioner. Not with this! I was running my fingers through it and through it and through it, amazed at the feeling! The conditioner was just as "luxurious"...there's no other word for it!I have since washed with just these 2 and I don't get the VAST amount of suds from that first wash, but that's not surprising...I probably would if I shampooed 3 times like I did that first time (but it's not necessary now.) I still get a lot of suds and that conditioned feeling, though. I MIGHT could go without the conditioner and use only the moisturizing shampoo, but my hair is super dry so I won't even try. I haven't had any adjustment period to this (again, could be because of the Ultra-Swim clarification?) What REALLY got me was that google-searching mentioned scratching your head and getting "dead skin cells" under your nails (which I totally did) but then they said it was actually the sulfates left over...and sure enough, I don't get that under my nails now! I love this stuff!!!! And I only wash my hair every 3 days, so it will last me a LONG time! I even brought some travel sizes to work to share with a couple of friends, and they're in love, too! But if you don't have dry hair, this is NOT the product for you!

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: I would pass
Review: I tried this set, including the deep conditioner and at first I fell in love.  After many uses of the same bottle, however, I all of a sudden noticed my hair was super tangly and dry and brittle.  I’ve never felt my hair this way before.  I can say in this time, the only changes that I made while I started using this product is less heat and using oils/ creams with no alcohol, so I feel strongly this set is what caused my hair to be so damaged.  Also, I have naturally curly hair that I chemically straighten to give you an idea of my hair type.  Lastly, after following them on Instagram, it looks like this product is a bit controversial as some of their chemicals contain formeldehyde releasers, which is super scary in itself.  Unfortunately, I will no longer be using.

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: 4C/Kinky/coiled/black girl hair
Review: Review geared to African american females. It does 30% of the job. You can't move around yourhair too much because you'll find it harder to detangle. You have to work your way in around the hair. This conditioner works best in one method: parting your hair into smaller sections, next quickly applying and combing through right away, and leaving conditioner to sit for 2-5 minutes (the longer the better) for softening. Finally a second rinse while gently rinsing hands through hair. It makes your hair stiff if you wash away quickly. Not a product i recommend if you don't have the patience to see best results which isnt much

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz
Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!!
Review: I've only used Tresemme Keratin Smooth since it came out I decided to try this and I'm officially in love with Maui. My hair is so soft and the smell is amazing. I finished by using the Maui Coconut oil mist.. again smells amazing and my hair looks and feels healthy. I have long, extremely thick hair.. I've read that switching to sulfate free is like putting your hair thru detox bc of all the chemicals that are in regular shampoo.. Might take a few weeks before getting the full affect of this shampoo bc of how damaged my hair is but so far so good. I love this. Ordered the Vanilla also.. can't wait to try that one!!! Highly recommended.. just give it a chance!!!

Product: Maui Moisture Heal & Hydrate + Shea Butter Conditioner to Repair & Deeply Moisturize Tight Curly Hair with Coconut & Macademia Oils, Vegan, Silicone, Paraben & Sulfate-Free, 13 fl oz

After reading the ingredients on the bottle I noticed it has DmDm hydrointoin in which CAUSES HAIR LOSS!!!!!! I am so upset right now....... my hair used to be so thick and beautiful.

The only things that are nice about this product are the smell and the advertising. The labels look cool; chemical free this, that, and the other, but the shampoo and conditioner produce awful results! Don't waste your money! Johnson &Johnson baby shampoo makes your hair so super soft, that my son, our Labrador, and I, all use that shampoo and it is fantastic! Don't waste your money on this product, neither the shampoo nor the conditioner! That's what I think anyway.

Review: i got this about 2 weeks ago with the shampoo and conditioner and i honestly love it. i’ve been trying to find something lightweight & hydrating for my thin-ish curly hair and this is perf. it doesn’t weigh it down, my hair isn’t frizzy, my curls look so pretty, and it doesn’t make my hair greasy (like someheavier creams do bc my hair is thin). would recommend for sure, hope this helps!HOWEVER, i used it paired with the shampoo & conditioner that are also purple. started noticing my hair falling out a bit more than usual, not sure if it was the switch from summer to winter and maybe it made it dry or maybe it was the shampoo & conditioner itself and not this product but idk. for now i’ve switched the shampoo & conditioner to see if it’s helped and suspended using the product but it worked SO well that i don’t wanna throw it out. might try again down the road

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: SHAMPOO REVIEW: 5 starsMy hair type is a pain to find good products for. It’s fine, 2A wavy, thick density, dry ends/oily roots, AND it’s been highlighted a few times, so the parts that are dry really are dry. I have a lot of problems with products being either too moisturizing and making my roots super oily/causing buildup, or products not being moisturizing enough and stripping my scalp. This shampoo is literally perfect. It has a creamy consistency, foams up really well, cleans my hair and scalp (even after a workout and two days of oil/sweat/dry shampoo), adds moisture, and even does a bit of detangling on its own (especially near my crown, which I desperately need because I usually can’t apply conditioner there). Not only that, but my hair is super soft, shiny, silky, and amazing looking when it dries. This is exactly what my hair needed, and it’s great for my scalp too. If your hair is similar to mine, this product is definitely worth a shot.SHAMPOO UPDATE:I’ve been using this shampoo for two months now, and I stand by my original review. It transforms my hair into silky soft wavy perfection with every wash. It’s absolutely worth every penny.REVIEW FOR THE AGAVE ANTI-BREAKAGE MASK: 5 starsI also bought the hair mask in this line because I wanted to give it a try. The hair mask also Is great from a first impression standpoint. I used it as a deep conditioning treatment after shampooing, and left it in my hair for about 5 minutes before rinsing it out.  After one use, my hair was noticeably softer, moisturized and wavy without being weighed down. It also detangled my hair, which is a huge plus, because I normally struggle with hair deep conditioners not doing enough detangling. All in all seems like a good product. Will keep using/update if I run into problems. Definitely worth the money so far!

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Update: has harmful ingredients.
Review: I cannot recommend this enough! It smells amazing, feels amazing was honestly a little hard to wash out, BUT my hair is crazy porous and was super oily bc I had run out of shampoo and had been using dandruff shampoo that didn’t lather. 😂 After the initial washing today, it got crunchy because I let my hair air dry but then you break that up by just scrunching your hair and YOU GUYS... so soft! Sorry for the run-on sentence but you just need to buy this ish. I’m spoiled. Never going back and no silicones and cruelty free!!! Big deal for me. Maui, keep doing what you do!Update: As great as the sensory experience was, look up the product in the “Think Dirty” app. It has a toxicity of 8. It lists the harmful ingredients for you. I’ve since switched to Acure and Seaweed Co.

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Great shampoo, as is the conditioner
Review: Great shampoo, as is the conditioner.A lot of people seem to have issues with Maui Moisture products, and to this I say: make sure you pick the right one for your hair type. Besides that, many people who switch from a commercial shampoo to something more natural without harsh chemicals can have a transition period where their hair and scalp freak out, for lack of better words. They're simply trying to get used to the new product and it can take a few washes. Having been using more natural products for 2-3 years, and picking the right one for my hair type, these are the best products I have found. They leave my hair soft, with little tangles, less hair falls out, less breakage. Overall healthier hair.

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: What Is This Sorcery?
Review: I was over due for a hair cut before the country shut down for quarantine.  I was convinced I was going to have to cut off at least 5 inches due to damage and was worried the longer I waited the more I'd have to cut. My hair would get so tangled all the time, I could never run my hands through it and I was frustrated because it seemed to break and never really grow.I gave Maui a chance because the price was right, but I didn't expect much. I was just out of conditioner in my shower. But after the first wash I noticed my hair was not the same. It was as though I had just come from the salon. My ends weren't looking like they'd been electrocuted; and looking at individual strands I didn't see the split ends. I can brush my hair in the am (which doesn't get totally tangled at night any more) and it stays soft and smooth all day.  I am so happy my hair looks so much healthier. I immediately replaced my shampoo and styling products with Maui. I am still in shock after a couple weeks at how nice my hair looks. I can't wait for my stylist to see it! Now instead of a bob, I may actually achieve my goal of hair down to my ribs!Btw, my hair is caucasian and fine and you might think this product would make my hair greasy, but it doesn't at all. I even used a few drops on towel dried hair and used it as a leave in, and my hair just sucks it up!

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Animal Cruelty, Parabens, Sulfate, Silicone Free & Vegan
Review: My local store no longer carries this formula (it does carry other formulas from Maui). Amazon has the best price I can find- dont purchase at Ulta. This is the only shampoo my daughter and I both can use otherwise double the costs for two shampoos and two conditioners with no extra space. We have a tiny apartment so there is limited space even with an over the shower caddy. We love the great results on my colored grey dry hair and her oil producing hair. We also love the fact Maui moisture is Sulfate-Free Surfactants, Parabens Free & 100% Aloe Juice first ingredient and all the other natural ingredients. My daughter is very particular about products she will purchase and use as she is vegan, limits chemicals and wants animal cruelty free.

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: This stuff is a godsend!!!
Review: This stuff is incredible. I use both the conditioner and the shampoo. The conditioner is the more important of the two in that it really makes your hair smooth and silky, like many other products promise. This is probably the only one I have found that actually smooth down the hair shaft and fights the flyaways and frizzies.  The conditioner and the shampoo. The conditioner is the more important of the two in that it really makes your hair smooth and silky, like many other products promise. This is probably the only one I have found that actually smooth down the hair shaft and fights the flyaways and frizzies. I have been using these for almost a year now and I could almost swear to you I have tried so many products in my past, and do you have a couple of favorites and other brands… However I am pretty sure that this has actually helped me grow my hair. And I just grow hair but grow healthy hair. I also use this when I had extensions put in, do not put it up where the extension is attached!! I have been using these for almost a year now and I could almost swear to you I have tried so many products in my past, and do have a couple of favorites another brands… However I am pretty sure that this has actually helped me grow my hair. And I just grow hair but grow healthy hair. I also use this when I had extensions put in, do not put it up where the extension is attached!!! BUT  I would use just a little dollop in my hand from about the midsection down to the ends to untangle the long extensions (about 24”).  Literally this stuff is a godsend.

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: New favorite shampoo!
Review: New favorite shampoo. I was anti-shampoo like most naturals for a long time. I eventually started making my own. But now I don't have to, for $6 I get THE BEST shampoo I've ever used. Like my scalp feels so clean and my hair moisturized after using it! This shampoo does not strip your hair at all! Plus it's vegan and free of harsh ingredients, try finding something better for $6. I have 3b/3c hair.

Title: My favorite gentle and ultra moisturizing shampoo
Review: This is probably the only shampoo that really works for my hair. I have wavy/curly hair that is damaged from heat and dye. I tried several brands and several products but THIS is the only shampoo that cleans my hair without making it feel dried out. My hair stays soft and it’s not weighted down. The brand also makes products that are vegan, sulfate free, paraben free and silicone free which is a plus.I started ordering it from Amazon because I can never find it anywhere in the stores: I tried Ulta, Target, Walmart and Meijer’s and they’re always out of this specific one. I wouldn’t be surprised if it was so popular cause it works really well!

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Switching Shampoo sometimes doesn’t pan out
Review: Been using for over a month now. Unfortunately disappointed. I have very thick and coarse hair. My hair has been falling out more and more. I saw this shampoo at my local pharmacy love the ingredients and wanted to give it a try. My texture did not improve it’s still very dry and brittle. After applying the conditioner usually the next day my hair as an awful greasy oily film. And as far as strengthening my hair I haven’t really noticed a difference still falling out. The good thing about for me is that I love smell of it. Some people say expensive brands aren’t all what they’re cracked up to be in my case that doesn’t hold true I will be going back to my more expensive brand shampoo because I know it works and it delivers results.

Title: Absolutely happy and confidence restored

I’m so happy with this! I never thought I’d find a shampoo and conditioner for me! I haven’t used conditioner consistently like this in years!!!

Title: Great shampoo, as is the conditioner
Review: Great shampoo, as is the conditioner.A lot of people seem to have issues with Maui Moisture products, and to this I say: make sure you pick the right one for your hair type. Besides that, many people who switch from a commercial shampoo to something more natural without harsh chemicals can have a transition period where their hair and scalp freak out, for lack of better words. They're simply trying to get used to the new product and it can take a few washes. Having been using more natural products for 2-3 years, and picking the right one for my hair type, these are the best products I have found. They leave my hair soft, with little tangles, less hair falls out, less breakage. Overall healthier hair.

Title: Love the Smell, helped with breakage but not good for a leave in
Review: Some Background: I have really curly, low-porosity hair. I also deal with a lot of breakage due to my hair being thin. That being said, most styling products leave my hair anywhere from dry and brittle to stiff and flat. As a result I dont bother with mousse, gels or sprays. I only use conditioners to style my hair which my hair absolutely loves.This Product: ROCKS for anti breakage for me. I've only been using it for a week. My hair didn't care for it as a styling product even when i diluted it with filtered water to use as a leave in to style with. It sort of left my hair looking sticky even tough it wasn't. But i noticed a significant difference in the amount of hair I was losing when i shampooed with Matrix Amplify shampoo and then used Maui Moisture.Conclusion: I will save this to use on weekends. I usually slather a moisturizing conditioner in m hair and put it up in a braided bun, then wash it after a couple of hours. I tried it one and my hair felt soft and moisturized afterwards. I will be trying other Maui products. The picture below is for you to see what my hair looks like. This was with the Maui moisture put in this morning to style with until i get my Redken Curvaceous leave in conditioner.SMELLS AMAZING!!!!!

Review: only 4 stars because the conditioner is difficult to get out of the bottle...it's super thick and the bottle is also pretty hefty...so it takes a little muscle!

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: I was super excited to try it out the minute I bought ...
Review: After buying this shampoo as well as the conditioner, I was super excited to try it out the minute I bought it and I did. I have very curly and pretty dry hair and had read reviews as this being one of the best affordable curly hair brands. I had seen on the label anti breakage so I chose this out of the rest and after one wash I was super happy with the results. This being said, I had used a deep conditioner right before. After two days, I used it again and got very different results. My hair felt very stringy and snapped when i pulled it. I also got that halo of frizz that drives me nuts. I thought this was so weird as my hair after using moisturizing products usually feels very healthy. I decided to check the bottle for ingredients and I am so glad I did. Maui Moisture claims to be sulfate free but as I was reading the bottle, I came across Olefin Sulfanate, Sodium Chloride and Hydroxysultaine as well as a few others that are very heavy dupes for Sulfates. I was very disappointed in the misleading product and to be honest kind of sad to see a brand that seems so trustworthy with product quality sneak things that made my hair even worse. Will not be purchasing from Maui Moisture again

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Smells AMAZING, and still does the trick!
Review: Hello! So a little about this thirsty mane of mine! It's very short (shoulder length) thick, dense, dark and CURLY (3C/4A) and this just did the most wonderful thing. After using their shampoo (Vanilla Bean is my favorite), I was ringing out my hair in sections and then I'd take this conditioner and it literally sank right into my strands (disclaimer: high porosity) under the warm water and my goodness (my curls popped), once I worked it into every section and braided it down with the conditioner still on it gave me so much slip!!! So I covered it with a plastic cap and did my towel turban thing after I finished off with a shower and rinsed this out with cold water (which felt so good btw) and hours later after drying my hair with an old tshirt my hair not only felt so soft and smelled INCREDIBLE, but their whole line together genuinely makes my hair retain so much MOISTURE! I definitely say get it!! I mix and match their product line scents how they work for me but there's no way you're gonna be disappointed! Serious slip. Bang for your buck. Can't go wrong! Plus it's vegan so knock yourself out!

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Not the worse thing but definately not the best
Review: I purchased this and the conditioner from the local Walmart. I dye my hair and bleach it often anyways so I try this product because it was so to be all natural and who doesn't want that kind of lifestyle. my hair is not really oily at all but this dried out my hair its by far one of the worse products I have used. Good luck if you try it and for those who don't be glad you didn't.

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Based on the reviews on Amazon as well as other sites it seemed like you either loved it or hated it
Review: I was skeptical about this product. Based on the reviews on Amazon as well as other sites it seemed like you either loved it or hated it, no in between. I personally love it. Maybe it depends on hair type. A bit of background on me..I'm 27, with hair that has been dyed since I was about 14. Currently its dyed blonde. I try to wash my hair only every other day and blow dry it. My hair also tends to be poofy so I also heat style with a flat iron pretty much every day. I had serious breakage issues. After the first wash my hair felt much better. Before you could touch parts of my hair and you could feel the almost straw like damage, and now while it is not completely gone it is much better. Smell is great too. With most products that lean more towards the natural side it can be a bit harder to work it through you hair and get it to soap up, especially if you have other products in your hair, but I found that to be no problem really. It can be slightly hard to get out of the bottles because its so thick, but not so difficult I would consider not using this. I personally have not had problems with hair falling out like other posters. The great thing about this product? Its relatively cheap. I had a $20 bottle of shampoo in my hand, when I put it back and decided to go with this. For the cost of less than $10 why not try it? You may be one of the ones who love it.

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: INCREASE in breakage!
Review: I want to start by saying that I absolutely love the scent of this shampoo and conditioner. The scent also seems to stay with you longer than other brands, but unfortunately that is where the positive things end for this duo.Contrary to what the bottle says, I have actually seen a INCREASE in breakage since I've started using this shampoo and conditioner a month ago. The conditioner also leaves a very heavy residue on my hair, making it feel like I haven't washed it in days. I can't even run my fingers through my hair because it feels almost like it's trying to mat. My hair has never done this with any other top brand shampoo and conditioners.Incredibly disappointed in this brand and will not be buying again, nor will I be recommending this product to anyone! Do your hair a favor and stay away from this shampoo and conditioner!

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Absolutely LOVE Maui Moisture
Review: I bought this, along with matching conditioner, at a local store and I absolutely LOVE it.  My hair hasn't been this wonderful in years.  I have less breakage and fallout after using the anti-breakage for 2 months now.  My hair is stronger, and getting back to its thickness, very quickly.  The scent is lovely for summer.  I'll be switching to the Thicken and Restore system once I'm done with the anti-breakage.  I'm excited to be using this product!

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: Another let down
Review: I just recently purchased the shampoo and conditioner and have been using it for almost 1 month. It smells really good and the smell stays but that's the only positive about this. I feel like there is a residue left on my hair that makes it feel dirty and almost matted. I had very high hopes but my hair is left feeling dirty, dry and knotted. Do not recommend , definitely if you have colored your hair or use heat on it.

Product: OGX, Maui Moisture Strength AntiBreakage + Moisturizing Agave Conditioner for Color Treated or Chemically Damaged Hair Vegan Silicone ParabenFree SulfateFree Surfactants, hibiscus, 13 Fl Oz
Title: So creamy!
Review: I am so amazed by this sulfate free shampoo. I do pre shampoo oil treatments on my hair overnight. With a lot of shampoos I have to either use a ton, or do two washes. I had to use very little of this product to get a fantastic lather. And my hair gets totally clean. The smell kind of reminds me of amber and tropical scents.

Review: As I learned from Netlflix documentary "Stink!" is that "Fragrance listed on the ingredients list in products can virtually mean anything and the chemicals don't need to be disclosed. Won't be using this product and swapping over to Shea Moisturizer.

Title: Love this product!!
Review: I have been using this shampoo and conditioner for about 2 months now and love it. Not only is it free from gluten ( I have an allergy, so that is important to me!) But it's also free from sulfate and many other chemicals. This shampoo and conditioner have changed my hair drastically. The frizziness of my hair has greatly diminished, the volume has increased. This is the only conditioner I've used that feels like it's actually working, rinses out with ease and does not leave my hair feeling greasy. I also use the conditioner on my legs for shaving. My legs are extremely sensitive and this conditioner leaves them sit, moisturized and helps provide a close shave. An absolute favorite for me!

It's heavy, weighted down, greasy (at the roots), frizzy (at the ends), dry, my curls are gone, and my blonde highlights are very faded and brassy.  I have to air dry my hair, because using my hair dryer leaves it in a frizzy knotted mess.  Not even a leave-in conditioner saves it.
